(C++) Canberra Distance Between Two Binary Vectors

Source: R/RcppExports.R
distance_canberra_cpp.Rd

Computes the Canberra distance between two binary vectors.

distance_canberra_cpp(x, y)

Arguments

x

(required, numeric vector).

y

(required, numeric vector) of same length as x.

Value

numeric

See also

Other Rcpp: auto_distance_cpp(), auto_sum_cpp(), auto_sum_full_cpp(), auto_sum_path_cpp(), cost_matrix_cpp(), cost_matrix_diag_cpp(), cost_matrix_weighted_diag_cpp(), cost_path_cpp(), cost_path_diagonal_cpp(), cost_path_orthogonal_cpp(), cost_path_slotting_cpp(), cost_path_sum_cpp(), cost_path_trim_cpp(), distance_chebyshev_cpp(), distance_chi_cpp(), distance_cosine_cpp(), distance_euclidean_cpp(), distance_hamming_cpp(), distance_hellinger_cpp(), distance_jaccard_cpp(), distance_lock_step_cpp(), distance_manhattan_cpp(), distance_matrix_cpp(), distance_russelrao_cpp(), importance_legacy_cpp(), importance_lock_step_cpp(), importance_robust_cpp(), null_psi_cpp(), null_psi_lock_step_cpp(), permute_free_by_row_cpp(), permute_free_cpp(), permute_restricted_by_row_cpp(), permute_restricted_cpp(), psi_cpp(), psi_formula_cpp(), psi_lock_step_cpp(), subset_matrix_by_rows_cpp()

Examples

distance_canberra_cpp(c(0, 1, 0, 1), c(1, 1, 0, 0))
